title: Hiron Point
details:
Hiron Point, also known as Nilkamal, is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the most popular tourist attractions in the Sundarbans. Located on the southwestern edge of the mangrove forest, it is known for its incredible biodiversity, scenic beauty, and tranquil environment. Visitors can spot a variety of wildlife here, including spotted deer, crocodiles, different species of birds, and occasionally the majestic Royal Bengal Tiger.

The journey to Hiron Point typically starts from Khulna or Mongla via waterways. Boats or launches are the primary modes of transportation, and the scenic river journey through dense mangroves is an experience in itself. The area is well-maintained, offering watchtowers and forest trails for a closer look at nature's wonders.

Hiron Point is an ideal destination for eco-tourism and birdwatching. Early mornings are the best time to spot wildlife, and the sunsets over the rivers create a mesmerizing view. Visitors are advised to travel with authorized guides to ensure safety and to make the most of their trip.
seasons: Winter (November to February): The cooler weather and calm waters make it the best time to visit.
Spring (March to April): Ideal for birdwatching and experiencing the vibrant flora of the Sundarbans.
cautions: Always travel with authorized guides and stay within designated areas to avoid any risks.
Do not disturb the wildlife or litter the environment.
Carry sufficient insect repellent and protective clothing to safeguard against insects and mosquitoes.
specials: A UNESCO World Heritage Site with unmatched natural beauty and biodiversity.
Home to the majestic Royal Bengal Tiger, spotted deer, crocodiles, and numerous bird species.
Watchtowers and forest trails offer excellent opportunities for eco-tourism and photography.
An unforgettable river journey through the Sundarbans' dense mangrove forests.
